subject: Philosophy
title: The View from Above
description: A quick win: understand The View from Above.

hook.text: Imagine zooming out from your body to see your city, your continent, then the whole planet.

buildup.text: Marcus Aurelius used this mental exercise to shrink his problems to their true proportion.

discovery.text: From the cosmos, your traffic jam, your argument, your missed deadline â€” they're invisible.

twist.text: This isn't nihilism. It's perspective. The point is to stop treating inconveniences like catastrophes.

climax.text: Astronauts report the same effect â€” seeing Earth from space changes what feels important.

punchline.text: Zoom out. Most problems are smaller than you think.

quiz.question: What is the purpose of the Stoic 'view from above' exercise?
options: To gain perspective and shrink problems to their true size
